column4: Hey, I've got a problem with Java/GCJ in Ubuntu (http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=476593), any ideas?
it does NOT depend on gcj. note the little word "or"
In theory it shouldn't, since it says it doesn't.. but when I do "sudo apt-get install eclipse".. it installs gcj too
yes, cause java from sun is in non-free/mutliverse
so how do I install eclipse without GCJ?
install java from sun, install eclipse
it should at least be recommended (not depended on)..
if you bothered reading my entire post you'd know I run Java from Sun already
still forcing GCJ to be installed
it cannot be a recommends. eclispe cannot work without an installed java
and Suns Java is not an installed Java? I don't quite see your point. As I stated in IRC and as I stated in my post: I have Suns Java
apt-cache show eclipse, apt-cache show sun-java6-bin apt-cache show  sun-java6-jre
in my post I also checked packages Azureus/Eclipse depends on... -_-, please read the entire post
why would if force an install of GCJ if I already run Suns Java? It seems very illogical to me...
sun-java6-jre, does it provide java2-runtime? (apt-cache show to check(
